title: Highly Contagious Disease
description: A deadly illness is spreading among the people. If we don’t act fast, it could wipe out dozens. How do we handle this crisis?

options.text: Beck - We set up a quarantine and do everything we can to help the sick. We can’t abandon our own.
options.outcome: Many are saved through careful treatment, but medical supplies and resources are drained. Some still succumb to the illness.

options.text: Old-Timer - Isolate the infected immediately. Strict rationing will keep the rest of us strong, even if it’s harsh.
options.outcome: The disease is contained, but those in quarantine suffer greatly. Some recover, some don’t. The people resent the harsh measures.

options.text: Shady - We can’t take risks of further infection. The sick must be exiled. No matter how sad it is, survival comes first.
options.outcome: The disease is wiped out swiftly, but the brutal response horrifies the survivors. The community may never be the same.
